FXUS04 KWBC 022304 PAA
QPFPFD
 
QUANTITATIVE PRECIPITATION FORECAST DISCUSSION
NWS HYDROMETEOROLOGICAL PREDICTION CENTER CAMP SPRINGS MD
603 PM EST SUN FEB 02 2003
 
FINAL DAY 1...DAY 2 AND DAY 3 QPF DISCUSSION
VALID FEB 04/0000 UTC THRU FEB 06/0000 UTC
REFERENCE AWIPS GRAPHICS UNDER...PRECIP ACCUM - 24HR
 
...18Z UPDATE..THE ETA AND GFS WERE IN VRY GOOD AGRMT WITH THEIR
PREVIOUS RUNS ACRS THE LOWER 48..SO LITTLE CHG WAS MADE TO THE
PRELIM DAY 1 QPF...

DAY 1....

...CNTRL ROCKIES INTO THE PLNS AND GTLKS...
MDLS ARE FINALLY COMING INTO SOME SORT OF AGREEMENT THRU THIS
REGION AFTR SVRL DAYS OF STG DISAGREEMENT. THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER
SOLNS DISCUSSED YDA SEEMS TO BE STILL THE FAVORED SOLN. THE GFS
IS STILL TRYING TO HANG ONTO A MORE SRN STREAM SFC LOW...BUT
CATCHES UP TO THE OTHER MDLS BY 36 HRS. THE BIG PROBLEM WITH
THIS SYS IS GOING TO BE THE LACK OF MSTR FEEDING NWD FM THE GULF.
SFC RDGG ACRS THE GULF WL GIVE UP SLOWLY AND KEEP THINGS
RATHER DRY FOR MUCH OF THIS PD. SO...MUCH OF THE PCPN WL OCCUR N
OF THE SFC BNDRY AND INVOF THE 8H/7H BNDRYS. NR THE END OF THE PD
WE COULD SEE A THIN BAND OF HIER MSTR FEEDING NWD AHD OF THE
SYS INTO THE GTLKS. THE STG MLVL VORT OVR THE GT BASIN WL SWING
THRU THE CNTRL ROCKIES THIS EVE/ERLY TNGT WITH HVY SNOWS IN THE
HIER TERRAIN. A BAND OF LGT/MOD PCPN WL XTND ENEWD FM THE CNTRL
ROCKIES ACRS THE PLNS INTO THE GTLKS. THE GTLKS REGION WL SEE
MOD LLVL THERMAL FORCING DVLP ON MON THAT SHLD COINCIDE WITH
INCREASING LLVL MSTR...SO HAVE GONE WITH THE HVIER ETA IN THIS
AREA. PLENTY OF WARM AIR WL STREAM NWD AND KEEP A LOT OF THE
PCPN MIXED THRU THE PLNS INTO THE GTLKS. SNOWS WL LIKELY FALL
ALG THE NRN EDGE OF THE PCPN SHIELD.

...LWR MS VLY...
SUB-TRPCL ENERGY LIFTING NEWD INTO MEX THIS AFTN WL BRING SOME
WEAK LIFT ACRS THE REGION LATE TNGT/MON. MSTR IS NOT DEEP...SO
ONLY SCTS SHWRS ARE XPCD.

...NEW ENG...
THE POWERFUL NOREASTER LIFTING INTO THE CANADIAN MARITIMES THIS
AFTN WL CONT TO WRAP DEEP MSTR ARND THE SYS AND INTO ME THRU
ERLY TNGT. MDLS ARE IN FAIRLY STG AGREEMENT...BUT THE ETA SEEMS
OVERDONE CONSIDERING THE DRY SLOT WORKING INTO THIS
AREA..WHICH SHUD HELP LWR PCPN AMTS. MOST OF THE PCPN WL BE
SNOW. SEE QPFHSD FOR DETAILS.



DAY 2...

IN THE EAST... THE MODELS ARE IN MUCH BETTER AGREEMENT THAN THEY
WERE YESTERDAY.  THE MAIN DIFFERENCE IS THAT THE GFS IS SLOWER
THAN THE ETA WITH THE SHORT WAVE SYSTEM SWINGING NEWD INTO THE
NORTHEAST.  THE OTHER MODELS GENERALLY SUPPORT THE FASTER
ETA... SO HAVE BASICALLY GONE ALONG WITH THE ETA PCPN PATTERN.
WIDESPREAD MDT TO LOCALLY HVY AMOUNTS CAN BE EXPECTED ALONG
THE ASSOCIATED FRONT IN THE APPALACHIANS... IN THE WARM
ADVECTION AREA TO THE EAST OF THE LOW IN NEW ENGLAND... AND TO
THE NORTH OF THE LOW IN SRN ONTARIO AND QUEBEC.  BEHIND THE
SURFACE LOW... LAKE EFFECT SNOWS WILL DEVELOP IN U.P. MI... AND IN
PORTIONS OF NR AND WRN L.P. MI.

UPDATE...  THE 18Z ETA SHOWS LITTLE CHANGE FROM 12Z... BUT THE 18Z
GFS IS TRENDING FASTER THAN EARLIER.  THIS FITS IN WELL WITH THE
SOLUTION ABOVE... FAVORING THE FASTER ETA. SO ONLY VER MINOR
CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE IN THE EAST IN THE DAY2 QPF. 

IN THE WEST... THE MODELS ARE A LOT CLOSER THAN YDA WITH THE
SHORT WAVE DROPPING SWD FROM CANADA THRU THE NRN ROCKIES. THE
ETA IS STILL SLIGHTLY WEST OF THE GFS WITH THE VORT MAX.  HAVE
GONE CLOSER TO THE ETA PCPN... WHICH RESULTS IN LIGHT AMOUNTS IN
MUCH OF THE NRN ROCKIES AND THE NRN HIGH PLAINS.  

UPDATE...  THE LATEST 18Z ETA AND GFS ARE BOTH TRENDING SLIGHTLY
TO THE WEST WITH SHORT WAVE ENERGY DROPPING SWD FROM CANADA.
THEREFORE... LIKE THE MODELS... HAVE EDGED THE LIGHT PCPN
WESTWARD IN THE NRN ROCKIES AND HIGH PLAINS.  


DAY3...


IN NRN NEW ENGLAND... MODELS AGREE THAT ONLY LIGHT PCPN LINGERS
IN NRN PORTIONS AS SYSTEM MOVES RAPIDLY NEWD INTO CANADA.

IN THE GREAT LAKES REGION... VERY COLD NWRLY TO WESTERLY LOW
LEVEL FLOW WILL CAUSE LIGHT LAKE EFFECT PCPN AMOUNTS.  BEST OF
THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE TO THE LEE OF LAKES ONTARIO AND SUPERIOR.

IN THE WEST... A WEAK IMPULSE AND THE FRONT LEFT EXIT REGION OF AN
UPPER JET MAX WILL HELP TO BRING MORE LIGHT PCPN TO THE NRN
ROCKIES AND THE NRN HIGH PLAINS.  MEANWHILE... THE DOWNSTREAM
SHORT WAVE WILL CONTINUE TO BRING LIGHT AMOUNTS TO PORTIONS OF
THE CENTRAL ROCKIES AND THE CENTRAL GREAT BASIN.  THIS SYSTEM
REMAINS STRONGER IN THE ETA THAN IN THE GFS... AND HAS THE
SUPPORT OF THE UKMET AND THE CANADIAN IN THAT RESPECT.

ECKERT/WOLF/LINDNER

GRAPHICS AVAILABLE ON THE WEB AT http://www.hpc.ncep.noaa.gov
